intro: Euchaetis longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract euchaetis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically broad and ovate, with a rough texture. Euchaetis longibracteata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
